title: Ryan Fitzgerald arrives for Sarah McGilvray's surprise WEDDING
text:
Fitzy & Wippa radio host Sarah McGilvray was married over the weekend.

And she surprised everyone by turning what was meant to be an engagement party into her actual wedding day.

Sarah wed her partner James Couche in a ceremony that included her friends, family and co-star Ryan Fitzgerald.

'The ultimate stitch up!' Ryan Fitzgerald (left, with wife Belinda) arrived for his Fitzy & Wippa co-host Sarah McGilvray's (centre) 'engagement party' on Saturday, only to discover it was her surprise wedding

Instead, those gathered for the event watched Sarah walk down the aisle in a stunning lace gown featuring pom-pom details before joining her for a celebratory lunch.

Sarah's unique dress was created by celebrity designer Rachel Gilbert, and featured a V neckline and veil.

Her groom opted for a blue suit, matching pastel tie and brown loafers.

Surprise! Sarah wed her partner James Couche (left) after inviting friends and family, as well as her co-star Ryan Fitzgerald, to what was meant to be her 'engagement party'

Stumbling into the room a half hour late and wearing jeans and a T-shirt was Sarah's co-host Ryan 'Fitzy' Fitzgerald, who had no idea he was attending a wedding.

Sarah's younger brother had just announced to the crowd: 'I'm going to let the cat out of the bag, a wedding happened today and it wasn't mine!'

Later on, Fitzy shared a photo to Instagram of the bride and bridal party at the reception and expressed his shock.

So romantic! Those gathered for the event watched Sarah walk down the aisle in a stunning lace gown featuring pom-pom details before joining her for a celebratory lunch

Chic: Sarah's unique dress was created by celebrity designer Rachel Gilbert, and featured a v neckline and veil. Her groom opted for a fitted, chic blue suit and matching pastel blue tie

'Ultimate stitch up!' Fitzy wrote in his caption. 'Rocked up half hour late to this little engagement shindig and @sarahmcgilvray and @couchie79 arrive over-dressed in wedding attire!

'So happy for you both, please enjoy the bottle of Yellow Glen we got you.'

Nova FM's Instagram page also announced the surprise wedding, sharing a post which read: 'We still can't get over the fact that @sarahmcgilvray surprised everyone and got hitched this weekend!'

What a shock! After the nuptials, friends and family partied at The Restaurant Pendolino in Sydney, which serves Italian fare

After the nuptials, friends and family partied at The Restaurant Pendolino in Sydney, which serves Italian fare.

Once she pulled off the amazing feat, Sarah discussed how she kept a lid on her plans during her radio show.

'I've had a few accidental slip-ups, it's been hard to keep it up a secret. So many people have been suspicious,' Sarah said on air afterwards.

'It was good fun, it was a really long day because obviously we got up, we went to the church, we got the kids baptised at the same time, and then we got married and then we obviously came to lunch.'

Private: Once she pulled off the amazing feat, Sarah discussed how she kept a lid on her plans during her radio show. 'I've had a few accidental slip ups, it's been hard to keep it up a secret. So many people have been suspicious,' she said. Pictured with husband James

'It was a very long day but everyone was having a very good time,' she added.

Sarah is known for surprises, having previously announced her engagement live on air back in June.

She shared the happy news with her listeners, revealing the hilarious way she was surprised by James, whom she affectionately calls 'Gary' on the show.

Happy news! Sarah is known for surprises, having previously announced her engagement live on air back in June. Pictured with husband James

She explained that her co-host Michael 'Wippa' Wipfli had duped her into thinking he was taking her and fellow colleague Tom Ivey out for a long lunch at the Rockpool restaurant in Melbourne.

But little did Sarah know, she was about to walk in on her own proposal.

'So I'm in my hotel room watching The Handmaid's Tale. I had forgotten what time was. I was a few minutes late and ran down to Rockpool,' she said on Nova FM.

Congrats! In June, Sarah recalled how James proposed with the help of her co-host Michael 'Wippa' Wipfli (right)

'I get there and I've been stood up by two of my mates, Tommy and Wippa. So I go in and say, "Booking under Wipfli". The waiter looks at me funny and goes, "Ah, yeah... hang on".'

She said the waiter took her around the corner and, much to her surprise, her partner James was sitting at the table.

Sarah realised it wasn't a work lunch at all, as the table had been set for two people.

Duped! She explained that Wippa had duped her into thinking he was taking her and fellow colleague Tom Ivey out for a long lunch at the Rockpool restaurant in Melbourne

'I sat down and they brought out some champagne and then "Gary" happened to look very, very nervous and had a certain question for me,' she said.

With the entire studio eagerly awaiting Sarah's next response, she said: '... and "Gary" and I are engaged!'

The radio personality shares two sons, six-month-old Thomas and two-year-old William, with James.
description: Fitzy & Wippa radio host Sarah McGilvray was married over the weekend.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
